Smart Power Strip: Create a smart power strip that can be controlled and monitored through a mobile app. Users can turn on and off, change brightness, and schedule timers for their devices remotely, ensuring energy efficiency and convenience.

Multi-port Power Strip with USB-C: Design a power strip with multiple USB-C ports, allowing users to charge multiple devices at once. The power strip can also include a built-in charging station for larger devices like laptops or tablets.

Portable Power Strip with Solar Panel: Create a portable power strip that can be charged using a solar panel, making it perfect for outdoor activities like camping or traveling. The power strip can also include a built-in battery, allowing users to charge their devices even when there is no sunlight available.

Power Strip with Built-in Surge Protector: Design a power strip with a built-in surge protector, providing users with an extra layer of protection against power surges and spikes. The surge protector can also be activated manually, giving users more control over their device's power consumption.

Motion-Sensing Power Strip: Create a power strip with motion sensors that can detect when a device is plugged in and turn it on or off automatically. This feature can help save energy by avoiding standby power consumption and also provide convenience for users who want to turn off their devices remotely.
